snippet: Even higher prices could not offset empty seats this summer as ticket sales at North American cinemas declined an estimated 3 percent from the period a year earlier.
abstract: Hollywood.com reports that ticket sales at North American cinemas fell an estimated 3 percent, to $4.28 billion, for the period from the first full weekend in May to Labor Day, compared with year-ago period; attendance was 533 million, down 4 percent from summer 2011.
lead_paragraph: Even higher prices could not offset empty seats this summer as ticket sales at North American cinemas declined an estimated 3 percent from the period a year earlier.

headline.seo: Ticket Sales Fail to Make Hollywood’s Summer
headline.main: Ticket Sales Fail to Make Hollywood’s Summer
headline.print_headline: Ticket Sales Fail to Make Hollywood’s Summer
